channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: North Sea plan permits new drilling on existing fields and no big shifts to clean energy
item.description: ‘Tie backs’ will permit small amount of new fossil fuel extraction, but campaigners want bolder strategy to ensure job creation Budget 2025 – live upd...

item.title: Budget 2025 live: Reeves scraps two-child benefit cap and confirms mansion tax as OBR apologises for leaking details
item.description: Office for Budget Responsibility blames ‘technical error’ after forecasts were published ahead of budget At a glance: the key points from the budget H...

item.title: Departing Marjorie Taylor Greene ‘the canary in the coal mine’ for Republicans, says former House speaker – US politics live
item.description: Kevin McCarthy says exit of the Trump loyalist turned critic is a sign of broader trouble for Republicans Bloomberg’s scoop showing how Trump aide, St...

item.title: Putin trying to negotiate an end to Ukraine war as he cannot win it on battlefield, says EU’s Kallas – Europe live
item.description: EU’s foreign policy chief says ‘there’s one aggressor and one victim’ in conflict amid US push to end the war In case you missed it, US president Dona...

item.title: Trump’s EPA moves to abandon rule that sets tough standards for deadly soot pollution
item.description: EPA had previously said rule reducing fine particle matter from vehicles and industrial sources could prevent thousands of premature deaths a year The...

item.title: Sudanese family says racist graffiti will not force them to leave home
item.description: The words 'local only' were daubed on Hala Ahmed's family home in Londonderry's Fountain estate.

item.title: Two-child benefit cap to be scrapped from next year
item.description: The policy, introduced under the Tories, means parents can only claim universal credit for their first two children.

item.title: Salary sacrifice pension contributions above £2000 will be taxed
item.description: Some pension savers face a hit to the amount of money they can put into their pension without paying national insurance.

item.title: Properties worth more than £2m in England face new tax
item.description: The surcharge begins at £2,500, rising to £7,500 for properties valued at more than £5m.

item.title: Key measures from this year's Budget at-a-glance
item.description: Rachel Reeves is delivering her second Budget since Labour’s return to power – here’s what you need to know.
